question: If the monthly income of Ramesh is ₹45,000, then find his total monthly expenditure (in ₹) on housing and transportation.
The sum of the cubes of two given natural numbers is 9728, while the sum of the two given numbers is 32. What is the positive difference between the cubes of the two given numbers?
How many students failed in Section C?
If 7 cot P = 24, then find sin P.

In a circular path of 600 m, Pankaj and Rohit start walking in opposite directions from the same point at the speeds of 2.85 m/s and 5.4 km/h, respectively. After how many minutes will they meet for the first time? (Rounded off to one decimal point)
If tan⁴θ + tan²θ = 1, what is the value of 11 (cos⁴θ + cos²θ)?
A can finish a job in 8 hours and B can finish the same job in 12 hours independently. If they work simultaneously, in how many hours can they do the same job?
60 men can complete a work in 30 days. However, if 10 men leave the group, how many days will the group take to complete the work?

Avinash’s monthly salary is ₹50,000 and his monthly expenditure is ₹18,000. Radha’s monthly salary is ₹60,000 and her monthly expenditure is ₹24,000. Find the ratio of Radha’s savings to Avinash’s savings.
In what time will ₹3,720 amount to ₹5,284 at 12% simple interest per annum?
The curved surface area of a right circular cylinder of height 56cm is 1408 cm². Find the diameter of the base of the cylinder.
Sara can finish a work in 18 days and Tara can complete the same work in 15 days. Tara worked for 10 days and left the job. In how many days can Sara finish the remaining work alone?
The average of all prime numbers between 32 and 69 is:
How many of the following numbers are divisible by 3 but NOT by 9? 5826, 5994, 6039, 6336, 6489, 6564, 6687 and 6960
